name: SunsplashedSerenity walk to Harvard & Fresh Pond
description: An elegant, sun-splashed, 2 bedroom (+2offices) apartment with parking, a 20-minute walk or 7-minute bike ride to Harvard.  Enjoy this spacious 1st floor unit in a stylish 3-level house, with its gorgeous yard and two bluestone patios, on a quiet leafy street in Huron Village Cambridge.  Sleeps 5.
neighborhood_overview:
Huron Village is known for its charm. We have playgrounds, a reservoir, small artisans, a used bookstore, antiques, and two bakery-cafes all within walking distance of Harvard Square. You'll also find scrumptious take-out in several local places. (URL HIDDEN)
(URL HIDDEN)
host_about: I'm a professor at one of the local universities and a long-time Cambridge resident.  I live on the second floor at 64 Granville Road with my daughter.  We enjoy sharing our "Cambridge tips" with all of our visitors: where to ice-skate in winter or rent a canoe in summer, the best local places for cheese, bread, and yummy ethnic take-out treats.  We can lend you bikes and direct you to the Minuteman Bikeway, an 11-mile shady ride through Arlington, Lexington and Bedford, or give you a couple of sleds and show you the hill at Fresh Pond.  Whatever the season, we look forward to welcoming you when you're in Cambridge.

name: Lovely Studio Room: Available for long w/ends
description: Large sunny room w kitchenette & bath. Foam mat can be added for 3rd person. Must love rescue dogs; Callie is a gem; likes pets when you come and go. Quality queen mattress, fridge, microwave, good wifi, en-suite marble bath. Quiet, leafy Cambridge neighborhood, moments from city life. Walk, bike or bus to Harvard, Tufts, MIT, Lesley . **Must like kids, adorable ones live above & you will hear their footsteps at times. Covid Vaccination. No lock on room or use of other rooms.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is quiet and friendly and our street is tree-lined, and known as one of the nicest blocks in what is a great neighborhood. It's far enough away from the main street so you won't hear any noise, yet within moments you can be at the subway or in Davis or Porter Squares. there's a sweet playground nearby, a bike trail extending 19 miles, and many parks. A Whole Foods and Trader Joe's are both within a 15 minute walk.
host_about: Friendly, politically progressive, resourceful... I love hosting people from all over the world, and know the area well for a native NY'er. You will find the environment 'on the court' restful, peaceful and as one  guest from put it, "I  figured you were a healer of some sort-- because your home feels healing." Our place is relaxing and down to earth, with  an artistic and colorful ambiance, and lots of sunlight.

name: East Cambridge Apartment
description: Our four bedroom home is tucked away in a wonderful neighborhood in East Cambridge.  Walk to great neighborhood restaurants and enjoy day trips to Boston with easy access to bus and train lines.  Enjoy the backyard and charm of Cambridge.
neighborhood_overview: Neighborhood is tucked away behind MIT and Kendall Square.  East Cambridge still has a strong Portuguese population that is apparent with grape vines surrounding our yard.  Our oldest son goes to school down the street and we love the community and our neighborhood.
host_about:
My wife and I are teachers north of Boston and have 4 children.  We enjoy traveling, being active, and spending time in Cape Cod and Lake Ontario.
  
As a family we enjoy seeing different places and experiencing different cultures.  We love the concept of Airbnb and as a young family, we love the idea of living somewhere else and having the flexibility/comforts of a kitchen and yard.

name: Harvard/MIT/BU/Central Square Room
description:
The Room includes a Bed, Desk, closet, remote overhead dimming light, and Air conditioner.

The apartment is a 3 bedroom 1 bath on the second and third floor of a 2 family house.

When more than one guest is present, the bathroom is cleaned weekly, and the entire house is cleaned every other week.

A bike with a helmet and lock is available during your stay.

This listing is for one of the 2 rooms in the photos, not both.
host_about:
I'm a software dev who has lived in Cambridge for many years & love all my town offers

Happy to offer local recommendations:
bike trails, kayaking & other outdoor activities (especially nature outings — the Charles River is 3 blocks away!), whale watching, comedy, museums, cultural events

You're also welcome to use my fleet of renovated bikes for exploring, free of charge

I’m always reachable for anything that will make your stay comfortable

name: Quiet private room in N. Cambridge
description:
I DO require all guests to not just having their Covid vaccinations but being up-to-date with the latest booster..

Quiet room w/ futon and couch, desk (not a work desk) , and closet.

Bus to Harvard Square leaves just around the corner. It's about a 10 to 14 minute ride depending on the time of day, and there is a subway connection there.There is also a subway stop about a 13 minute walk from my place.

I have a lot of hosting experience and can provide good tips on an individual's interests.
neighborhood_overview: This was the working class neighborhood of Cambridge, the area where former speaker of the house, Tip O'Neil, grew up. A lot of condos have gone up in the neighborhood. It's an area that borders Arlington and Somerville, and Belmont and Watertown are also very close.
host_about:
I am a senior and may be immune compromised so please be advised I can only accommodate guests who are up to date with their COVID boosters or pledge to get it at least 2 weeks before their arrival date. 

I am passionate about music including music from many different areas of the world. I've traveled extensively on a budget and am very resourceful helping those who may have a limited budget to find things to do that they can afford.

name: Victorian Charm MIT/Hrvd/ /CentralSq, private deck
description: Welcome to our 100-year-old house! Cozy, friendly and full of charm. Very convenient to MGH, MIT & Harvard. Our location is hard to beat: close to both subway and bus with many excellent restaurants in walking distance. Located in Central Square, we are also an easy walk to Kendall and Inman Squares. For runners and walkers, the Charles River paths are 0.5 mile away. This unit features hardwood floors and nine foot ceilings. The private back deck is very popular.
neighborhood_overview:
Despite our urban setting, our neighborhood is very quiet, particularly at bedtime. It has always been the kind of neighborhood where women can walk alone safely at night. Generally speaking, this side of the river is dramatically calmer than the Boston side though now bustling with a nice variety of great restaurants.

We actively recycle. There is a blue bin in the unit. Or, we can do it for you if you simply keep glass, plastic and metal trash together and separated from trash. We also keep a compost container in the fridge for vegetable trash. We'll empty it into the big bin outside when you leave.
host_about:
We are a pair of classical musicians in Cambridge, located between MIT & Harvard. As with much of Cambridge, we're hopeless lefties. 

On parle un peu de français. Hablamos poco español. Und ein bisschen Deutsch auch.

Most Sundays you'll find us "making a joyful noise" at one church or another.
We've been in this old house and this neighborhood over 20 years now. Since we cook a bit, the rental floor fridge and pantry might contain a little overflow from ours. We're huge fans of Airbnb both as guests and as hosts. Leave your towels and sheets at home; we provide all that for you. Our biggest challenge as Airbnb hosts is saying goodbye to the awesome people who stay with us.

description: Located in Porter Square Cambridge, you are minutes from most of Cambridge including Harvard, Lesley, and Tufts. Restaurants, stores and subway all within a few blocks of your front door. Or visit downtown Boston just 15 minutes by subway or taxi.
neighborhood_overview:
Porter Square is a great neighborhood for all different types of dining. Great options to enjoy a glass of wine or cocktail alone or with a friend. For even greater variety visit Davis Square or Harvard Square within walking distance.
Safe neighborhood with convenient transportation, dining and shopping.
host_about: I think you will find me easy going with a good sense of humor. Happy to tell you about the area and make suggestions on places to go and where to eat. Technology Project Management and Operations has kept me busy during the week.

neighborhood_overview: Proximity to Harvard (0.8 miles) and Inman Squares, great restaurants within walking distance, interesting architecture.

name: Holistic Living Center
description: This ample bedroom is on the first floor and is a comfortable space. The kitchen and bath are shared. All utilities and wi-fi, cable tv, and linens included. Minimum stay: 31 nights. Located in a first floor apartment that doubles as a small urban retreat center. Open to all ages, creeds, and colors, and rainbow friendly. We have a meditation room and weekly potluck suppers which our guests are invited to.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is residential yet quite vibrant and has many services within walking distance. Two blocks in one direction is the wonderful café Sofra with homemade confections and middle eastern dishes. One block in the other direction is Shangri-La: an excellent Chinese restaurant. Two blocks away is Greg's, a neighborhood Italian eatery with full bar and early bird specials. Also within a block are a well stocked liquor store/wine shop, a middle eastern bakery, and a dry cleaners. If you want to walk five blocks to Coolidge Square there is a tasty vegetarian restaurant (Red Lentil), a great diner (Town Diner), a tiny but very good middle eastern eatery (Jasmine), and a super coffee/lunch spot (Uncommon Grounds). A supermarket (Shaws) is four blocks away. A jogging trail around Fresh Pond is six blocks away as is a very nice nine hole golf course. All of this only a ten minute bus ride from Harvard Square!
host_about: I am a long time Cambridge resident having come here originally to attend Harvard Divinity School. I'm a residential real estate agent practicing in Cambridge and Boston. I co-own a three-family residence in Fresh Pond Cambridge and rent out two rooms and a studio through airbnb at my residence where I also reside. I'm interested in health and help run a small meditation and holistic health group out of the first floor apartment in addition to the room rentals. My interests also include gardening, interior design, travel golf, and of course hosting on airbnb! I like providing beautiful and comfortable spaces for my guests to enjoy. I own an RV and love to go camping to the mountains and seashore with my friends and especially my grandchildren. My favorite travel destinations are New Orleans, Savannah, Georgia, and Palm Springs California. I like all kinds of foods and especially my veggies, and I'll give you my cole slaw recipe; grate a cabbage and some carrots, add a grated fresh anise and an apple to the mix, then add some organic cider vinegar and olive oil mayo to taste (this mix tastes so good, you can try it without mayo). My musical tastes are also wide and include jazz, pop, and a cappela.

name: Charming Victorian Home in Cambridge
description:
Welcome to this charming Victorian home just a 10-minute walk or 5-minute trolley ride to Harvard Square.
- Stunning old charm with vaulted ceilings
- Relaxing deck off the kitchen for meals and gatherings
- Beautifully landscaped garden yard with seating
- Big screen TV and comfortable sitting areas
- Off-street parking available, a rarity in Cambridge
- Accommodates 8 people comfortably with four queen and one king beds
- The upstairs pillow sofa is a favorite spot for all
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled up to Harvard and surrounds the neighborhood is quiet, well established, and beautiful with a lot of history and many famous residents past and current.

Located in the neighborhood of Cambridge called Huron Village, the home is blocks away from the historic Longfellow house, Harvard, Radcliff, Leslie and the entire area exudes Victorian charm.

There is easy and quick access to local stores, tree lines streets, and it offers exceptionally easy access to all things Cambridge and Boston, no car required!
host_about:
I love anything with a story behind it.

In Phoenix, we offer a perfect sanctuary near the city's attractions.

In Cambridge/Boston, we care for a 124-year-old Victorian with New England charm, preserving its classic features and greening where possible. 

We share these homes, using earnings to renovate further. We hope you love them as much as we do!

We also help owners share their special homes with others.

name: Stylish Simple 2 Bed Flat in Harvard MIT
description:
Pls do not place booking request 'Contact Host 1st

HUMBLE 2-bedroom apartment just steps away from Harvard University & MIT in the heart of Harvard Square. Our peaceful & tastefully decorated unit is perfect for light sleepers & features study desks in each room. The Red Line station is nearby for easy transportation. MESSAGE US before booking to ensure personalized experience during your stay. Enjoy all that Harvard Square has to offer, including restaurants, shops & cultural attractions.
neighborhood_overview:
Discover the best of Cambridge from this prime location. Just a 3-minute stroll to Harvard Square and a 10-minute walk to Central Square Station, you'll have easy access to the rest of the city. Enjoy great coffee shops, top-rated restaurants and bars, and explore the city's vibrant cultural scene.

Other nearby attractions include the magnificent Cambridge Public Library and its beautiful park, just half a block away. For your convenience, a full grocery store and drug stores are only a 3-minute walk away.

Getting around is a breeze, with all major bus stops and the Harvard Square Red Line just minutes away. Whether you're here to be part of the Harvard community or heading to Boston, this unbeatable location puts it all within reach.
host_about:
Human first. Herd being. Lover of community.

Harvard affiliate. Design enthusiast. Longtime Boston/Cambridge resident—by way of the West Coast, the Midwest, and now here. Born and raised in a world-famous country (ask me which one!).

I have a deep love for antiques, and for me, designing, creating, and caring for a home is truly therapeutic. Hosting and toasting—well, the rest is history.

Beautiful 2BR/1BA in quiet West Cambridge with deck and backyard... small pet-friendly!

House is on a residential street 1/2 block from Fresh Pond, a tranquil 2.5 mile loop providing drinking water to all of Cambridge.

Free, ample street parking.

name: Harvard & MIT- Sweet Retreat in Coolest Cambridge!
description:
Our Sweet Retreat is quietly hidden away in the heart of Cambridge, steps from a cafe, bike sharing, MBTA, Harvard, MIT, shops, and eateries — as well as equidistant to Harvard, Inman, and Central Squares. The apartment is comfortably furnished and INCLUDES off street PARKING!

We will greet you and point you to the historical, artsy, free, outdoors, music, restaurants, beaches, and etc. As friendly, long time Cambridge residents (designers and world travelers!), we know the hidden gems too.
neighborhood_overview: This is an old neighborhood of owner occupied homes once used as servants' quarters for the Brattle Street mansions near Harvard Square in the old, Victorian days. We neighbors all know each other, so things run smoothly. It is safe, quiet, friendly, and has GREAT coffee steps away.
host_about: Artist, textile/accessories designer, and global traveler with a particular love for Asian markets, vintage textiles, and artisans !! My daughter and I lived in Vietnam for the better part of 7 years, and our home is definitely a mini gallery of our travels. I am positive you will feel very happy to be in the midst of lovely colors, interesting books, and, best of all, in a seemingly quiet corner of Cambridge, tucked away, that in actuality — is in the center of all!

name: Private Apartment. Dog friendly. Parking
description: Take advantage our private, cozy Cambridge home. It is minutes from Harvard Sq. and Boston. Its close proximity to Fresh Pond is a bonus. Our friendly, Strawberry Hill neighborhood offers easy parking, great local eateries or a quiet night in. Dog friendly at no extra fee!
neighborhood_overview: Strawberry Hill is a very friendly neighborhood between Huron Ave and Mount Auburn Street. There are numerous little places by local owners offering a multitude of food within a ten minute walk.  All along Belmont Street one can find - Sofra ( a spinoff from Oleana) is a quick walk away; Eastern Lemejun has delicous Armenian & middle eastern offerings; Conleys Pub and sports bar is always serving up food and drinks; Homemade Greek yogurts and foods can be found at Sophia's on Belmont St, and just before that Linda's Donuts makes the best home made donuts from scratch every morning; Fiorellas has pizza and Italian; At Aram's Cafe, one can get a breakfast or lunch cooked by Aram himself, whose establishment has been cooking up delicious entrees for over 30 years; Moozies Ice cream for homemade ice cream and an outdoor movie screen in warm weather. There is a large supermarket, liquor store and drug store in Star Market as well as local food shops. The Fresh Pond Golf Course and Waterwork
host_about: I am an artist, cook, gardener, mom and teacher. I love to bike around FreshPond, kayak on the Charles River, watch my children's sports games, head to Rhode Island (my hometown ) for the beach. I love the city and all it has to offer.

Sunny and spacious with two bedrooms and a separate food preparation/living and dining area.
neighborhood_overview: The area between Harvard and Porter Squares is one of the most lively and interesting parts of Cambridge, as is Davis Square which is also nearby. Temple Bar, Giulia, and numerous other great restaurants, takeout places and cafes are right around the corner. Abodeon, Pod, Nomad, and Joie de Vie plus the unusual vintage stores and music venues of Davis square are just a few of the interesting possibilities. The Peabody Museum with its exquisite glass flowers and the newly renovated Harvard Art Museums are within walking distance.

name: Sunny Huron Village Apt. w/ Terrace
description: Our two-family home in West Cambridge includes a new one bedroom apartment on first floor, with sunny bedroom, living room, new kitchen & bath, as well as a wonderful private garden terrace.  Easy commute to Harvard Sq on foot or by bus.  Excellent WiFi for working remotely.
neighborhood_overview: West Cambridge is a hot neighborhood at the moment, with great urban amenities and excellent green spaces. Nestled between the historic homes of Brattle St, the unique shops of Huron Village and the green spaces of Fresh Pond reservoir and Danehy Park, there's lots to do and see. Jog or walk the 2 mile loop around the Pond, explore historic neighborhoods and sample the many interesting food shops. Or wander down to Harvard Square and all the university has to offer with museums and bookstores galore. Major retailers like Whole Foods and Starbucks are also a short walk away.
host_about:
I have lived in Cambridge for over 25 years.  I moved here for graduate school at Harvard and never left.  Currently, I'm a baker and  pastry chef  ( Instagram:  @hazelnama ) working part time in local bakeries.   However, my primary job is raising our eleven year old son.

I love to travel and have been all over world (most of that before having a child).  My partner and I spend a good deal of time in Maine but are plotting trips much further out as our son gets a little older.  

As a host I'm very accessible but mostly hands off.  I'm more than happy to answer any questions, point you in the direction of great restaurants or sights but tend to let our guests enjoy the space as they like.

name: Charming Victorian Retreat in Cambridge
description:
Welcome to our newly remodeled Victorian home, blending charm with modern convenience.
- Two bedrooms with luxury queen-sized beds
- High-end inflatable airbed available for children/teens
- Stunning hand hammered copper Japanese soaking tub
- Large rainfall showerhead
- Workspace setup with internet and monitors
- Off-street parking space available

neighborhood_overview:
Nestled up to Harvard and surrounds the neighborhood is quiet, well established, and beautiful with a lot of history and many famous residents past and current.

Located in the neighborhood of Cambridge called Huron Village, the home is blocks away from the historic Longfellow house, Harvard, MIT, Radcliffe, Leslie and the entire area exudes Victorian charm.

There is easy and quick access to local stores, tree lines streets, and it offers exceptionally easy access to all things Cambridge and Boston, no car required!
host_about:
I love anything with a story behind it.

In Phoenix, we offer a perfect sanctuary near the city's attractions.

In Cambridge/Boston, we care for a 124-year-old Victorian with New England charm, preserving its classic features and greening where possible. 

We share these homes, using earnings to renovate further. We hope you love them as much as we do!

We also help owners share their special homes with others.

name: Live Like A Local - 2 Bedroom Behind Harvard Law
description: Step into history with this Philadelphia-style apartment in the Garfield Historical District. In a 1900 Victorian 2-family house, enjoy spacious comfort with a second-floor bedroom. A reserved driveway parking spot adds convenience to your stay. WIth just a 17-minute stroll to Harvard Square and five blocks to Porter Square, location is key. Groceries from Star Market, delightful cafes, and a plethora of restaurants are at your fingertips, adding ease to your Cambridge experience.
neighborhood_overview:
Here are some benefits of choosing our 2-bedroom apartment in Cambridge:

- Typically more cost-effective than booking two hotel rooms
- More spacious than a standard hotel room, providing guests room to relax
- Savings of $35/night with an included parking space
- Fully equipped kitchen for preparing meals and storing snacks, saving dining out costs
- Authentic city-living experience in a residential neighborhood

Your considerations of 17 Traymore are valued. However, please note this apartment may not suit if you intend to host guests. Review house rules before booking.

Located in Cambridge's Baldwin (formerly Agassiz) neighborhood / Garfield Historical District, often historically referred to as North Harvard due to its proximity to Harvard Yard, Harvard Law, and Lesley University. The district beautifully blends academic buildings, student housing, and Victorian wood-frame houses. With around 5,000 residents, it's a cozy, moderate
host_about: This Cambridge local has been living in their charming home for over 20 years and knows the ins and outs of the city. With 6 years of hosting experience under their belt, you can trust that they will make your stay comfortable and unforgettable. From insider tips on the best local restaurants to providing a cozy and inviting atmosphere in their home, this host goes above and beyond for their guests. Experience true Cambridge hospitality!

description: Easy Scenic walk to both Harvard and Porters Sq in Cambridge. Minimum Monthly Stay and price reflects this.
neighborhood_overview:
Cambridge is rich in history and bustling with activity, full of beautiful examples of old colonial architecture and a wonderful town to walk in. All of the following are within a 5 minute drive or an easy 20 minute stroll from the apartment.
East:
Harvard Square
Harvard University
American Repertory Theater
Cambridge Common
Tory Row
Harvard Museum of Natural History

West:
Fresh Pond Park
Wholefoods
Mt. Auburn Cemetery
Apple Cinemas

South:
Longfellow House
The Charles River
The Charles River Bike Path

North:
Porter Square
Davis Square

Withing ten minutes of driving are MIT, Central Square, Kendall Square.

Hop across the river to get to Fenway Park, Newbury Street, the Museum of Fine Arts, and Boston's other attractions.

There is a binder in the apartment with information on great places to see and interesting things to do.

We would love to host you in this very cosy space, tastely decorated and furnished condo that used to call our primary home.

name: Smack dab between Harvard+Porter 2
description:
The room has a double bed and is on the third floor, cozy and quiet, among the tree tops. At night you have the stars, and by day the room is light and sunny.

The room has wide, old pine board flooring, a sky light with a room-darkening shade, mini-split, closet, dresser, large desk with office supplies, yoga mat, full length mirror, and a fan.

This bedroom shares a full bathroom with the other third floor bedroom which is also rented through Airbnb.
neighborhood_overview:
This neighborhood is very special in that it is quiet, you can hear birdsong most times of the day, there are lovely gardens all around. And you will be just 3 blocks from Massachusetts Avenue (Mass Ave), the busiest street in Boston/Cambridge. Or, if you are here in winter, the quiet of the cold air is lovely too, and if we are lucky, you'll see snow!

Along Mass Ave, you can walk to many local run businesses of every sort: gift shops (Joie de Vivre, Nomad, Abodeon, Tokai), coffee shops (Simons, Hi-Rise, Starbucks) and so many restaurants of every ethnicity (Indian, Japanese, Thai, Italian, Mexican, American). You can take a walk from here to the Charles River, through Harvard Square. You can stroll down Mass Ave to Central Square where there is a whole new world waiting for you, but just as Cambridge as any other place! Somerville is just minutes away too (Davis Square, Inman Square, Union Square), and it is an amazingly rich community for music, food and funky shops
host_about:
Hello!  

I've lived in Cambridge for 38 years.  I am an artist;  I paint, draw and sculpt.   I am a rather quiet person, with a good sense of humor.   I live with two cats, Aiko and Minkah.  They are friendly and enjoy guests. 

I love living in Cambridge.  It's a rather small town with so much to offer.  Boston is also very close by, accessible by the subway, bus or Uber.  There's so much to see and do there as well!    

This is a wonderful neighborhood and I really love sharing it with people.  It is good to remember the ocean is also near by and it is accessible by subway, rail or bus.  There are countless historical sites, museums, restaurants and shopping experiences in the area.  

I hope you will consider visiting Cambridge and staying at Smack Dab!

description: Location, location, location. Close to everything: Boston, MIT, Harvard, Mass General Hospital. Very nice old house with all the commodities. One Bed accommodates one person.
neighborhood_overview: The house is in East Cambridge, 3 blocks away from Boston and the Charles River. You will enjoy great walks and running by the river. Boston is just across the Charles. Friendly family neighborhood with grocery store and mall close by. Logan Airport is 15 minutes away. Enjoy Boston for a third of the price!
host_about: I am a legal Spanish interpreter, love what I do & think Airbnb is really cool. My two cats Amadeus Mozart and Dizzy Gillespie make me smile. Amadeus is white and Dizzy is black. name: Private room and bath, walk to Harvard & MIT
description: Sunny bedroom with private bathroom and private stairway in a charming Cambridge location. This is an easy walk to public transportation, the Charles river and major universities. Parking available in driveway. About 7 minutes walk to the T. Bikes on loan nearby.
neighborhood_overview: It's peaceful and safe. Very convenient as well. Our favorite restaurants within easy walking distance: Pagu (a tad pricey but good), Shanghai Fresh, Viale, Life Alive (vegetarian), Moody's Falafel (an unassuming looking place, but excellent falafel).
host_about: I teach 7th and 8th graders at an independent school in the Boston area. I have two daughters, both in college. I travel a good deal in the summers.

name: Best of Cambridge! Harvard, Porter, Davis Squares
description: Comfort and Location! This charming Cambridge apartment is on the first floor of our 2-family home on quiet, pretty Hollis Street, steps from Davis Square (Somerville) and Porter Square (Cambridge),  including Harvard Sq. which is 1.5 miles away. You won't need a car - we are next to public transportation to Boston, its colleges and medical centers,  and all surrounding communities.  Save significant money if you rent more than 31 days because there will be no state or local taxes.
neighborhood_overview:
This is a safe neighborhood with a lot of open space. Besides our yard, which is considered large by city standards, there is a school with public playing fields, two playgrounds, and public tennis courts at the end of the street on Rindge Avenue. Right around the corner, on Sherman Street, there is a giant public park - Danehy Park - with playgrounds and playing fields, trails for walking and jogging, and in the winter, a giant hill for sledding.

The location gets even more perfect....You can get easily anywhere and everywhere from Hollis Street without a car. Walk, bike, or take public transportation. You will be close to the major universities, museums, medical centers, and other attractions of the Boston- Cambridge area. Hip Davis Square (Somerville) is just short five -minute walk, with its historic movie theater and great restaurants. There are many other restaurants right around the corner on Massachusetts Avenue, like Urban Kitchen (American), Café Barada (Middle
host_about:
I'm a college professor, with a husband and 3 grown kids and Cambridge is our home. We have a two family house in North Cambridge that was built in 1926. My husband, Gerry, and I live in the upstairs apartment and our first floor apartment is available for short and long-term guests. 

We also have a 3 bedroom cottage a few steps from Nantucket Sound in Harwich Port Cape Cod.  Sometimes we rent our cottage to guests in the summer months.

neighborhood_overview: The house is in a beautiful, historic conservation district with many beautiful gardens and well maintained homes from the 1800's. Restaurants, shops, transportation and parks are within a few minutes' walking distance. On-street parking is usually very easy and free with the use of a Visitor's Parking Permit, which we can lend to guests.

name: Cambridge Bed and Bath
description:
Lovely bedroom and full private bath in my home on quiet residential street, cozy, private, lots of natural light, or block the light with shades. Super comfortable bed. You may use the kitchen and dining area. Shops and restaurants nearby. 5 to 10-minute walk to Porter Square subway station, 20-minute walk or 5-minute subway ride to Harvard Square. Bluebikes bike share station 1-minute walk away.

I ask that guests be fully vaccinated against COVID. Thank you.
neighborhood_overview: My neighborhood is quiet and safe, and also close to all kinds of stores and restaurants, and the subway.  It's a 5-10 minute walk to Porter Square and a 20 minute walk to Harvard Square.  A Bluebikes bike share station is a 1-minute walk away; you can unlock a bike and return it to the same station or any other station in the system.

name: Sunny, spacious 2BR w/roof deck near Harvard and T
description: Steps away from public transport (subway, bus, bikes) in a lovely historic neighborhood!  Our guest suite is on the 3rd floor of our elegant home in Porter Square.  You’ll have the entire floor: 2 bedrooms, private bath and private roof deck; we will share the entrance and stairway.  We are surrounded by restaurants and shopping, and, as natives, have lots of tips!  Microwave, fridge and coffee/tea in the suite.  We speak German, French and some Arabic.
neighborhood_overview:
Lively, very safe neighborhood full of restaurants, shops, galleries and playgrounds. Harvard Yard and the Harvard museums and arts venues are nearby, as are Lesley , MIT and Tufts. Nearby Davis Square is a delight!
There are so many colleges in walking, bus and subway range that we are a popular two-bedroom choice for families' college visiting and graduations, for visiting academics and artists, and of course we love to welcome tourists to our beautiful native city!

name: Modern studio in Cambridge townhome

name: Spacious Strawberry Hill Suite (West Cambridge)
description:
This 3rd floor suite is less than 2 miles west of Harvard Sq. You'll have exclusive access to the space, which has a full bathroom and kitchenette.

There is a queen bed suitable for two people and the couch in the living room converts to a bed for one.

Our neighborhood is friendly, safe, and has a lot to offer. Public transportation (bus) is a 5 minute walk. The trip to Harvard Square is 10-15 minutes.

I live in the home downstairs and am available should you need me during your stay.
neighborhood_overview:
We are located in Strawberry Hill, the smallest neighborhood in Cambridge, and very close to the borders of Watertown and Belmont, Mass. The house is approximately 2 miles west of Harvard Sq., which is easy to get to via public transportation. We’re also near Fresh Pond (about a 10-minute walk) which has lovely trails for walking, running, biking and more.

This listing faces a cemetery, which is very common in this area but worth noting. The cemeteries in this area are well maintained parks. specifically Mount Auburn Cemetery which offers tours.
host_about:
Welcome to my childhood home!

My favorite thing to do on weekends is try new restaurants in Boston and Cambridge. Let me know if you want suggestions!

I try to go to as many live shows as I can. My favorite venues are: Roadrunner and the Sinclair.

Favorite travel destinations: Stockholm; Erfurt, Germany; Mauritius; Porto, Portugal.

Currently binge-ing on: RuPaul's Drag Rae and any show where they restore an old house.

description:
Due to severe allergies that my spouse has, we are UNABLE to host any animals on our property as we share a central AC/heating.

Furnished basement STUDIO- cozy, comfortable, and luxurious place- historic neighborhood with peace.

Private laundry in the unit-kitchenette, Hi-speed Internet - free parking on street

neighborhood_overview: Our place is in an historic, green and peaceful neighborhood of Cambridge.
host_about:
I am a an entrepreneur in fashion and urban designer. 

My spouse is a biotech entrepreneur. We have two little precious children, two active but cute kids. My spouse, our kids, and I have traveled in the North, South, and Central America, Europe, Middle East, and Asia so far. We love to discover different cultures and meet people from these beautiful, lovely, and nice societies. 

We would be very much happy to host you in our lovely, warm, and friendly place which is disinfected and cleaned properly all the time. Please feel free to interact with us, share your experience, tell us your stories and be part of "the moment" that could give all of us a different point of view about each other, our wonderful planet, and life! 

We tend to give privacy to our guests, so feel free to let us know if you would like to get in touch in person. We are more than happy to say hi in person. 

You are more than welcome to be part of our neighborhood by following CDC's health requirements due to the COVID-19 pandemic, respectfully!

name: private studio near Harvard/MIT
description: My place has everything you need for a comfortable, easy stay in Cambridge: a  keyless entry to a completely separate studio space allows you to arrive anytime after 3,  so no worries if you arrive on the late side. You''ll find a queen sized bed, microwave/fridge/coffeemaker,  streaming TV, comfortable recliner and a desk chair for when you're working.  We're walking distance from Kendal, Central, and Harvard Squares.  On street parking in our neighborhood using our visitor pass, upon request.
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood has a mix of younger professionals, families, and students. We're right next to a city park, 5 minutes from Central Square, and walking distance from Harvard Square and Kendal Square. Central Square has a big collection of restaurants, from alternative vegetarian to Indian, Chinese, the best sushi restaurant in Cambridge, and many more.
host_about: When I travel, I want to feel comfortable and at home wherever I'm visiting, as much like I"m living there as possible.  That's what we've created here: a comfortable little home smack in the middle of Cambridge, 5 minutes from the MBTA subway system, and a lovely walk to Harvard in one direction and MIT/Kendal Square in the other.

name: Harvard/MIT (Unit 1)- Brooklyn Ambiance w/ Parking
description: Central Square is known for its diversity, upscale, ethnic eateries and a vibrant club scene.  Easy walk to Central Square subway (3 min), MIT (12 min) and Harvard (15).   Our apartment offers parking for 1 large car, and a well-equipped kitchen for entertaining.
neighborhood_overview: Central Sq. is hot!  Lots of great dining options.  Walking to either MIT or Harvard is very easy.  Cambridge is a bike friendly city.
host_about: I am an English teacher for new Americans own the two unit apartment building.    If unable to personally greet you, our two sons will be happy to assist you.  We live two miles away from this building.   We have developed an "insider's guide to Cambridge" to provide you with a solid foundation to enjoy your stay.  We frequently stay with Airbnb hosts when we travel.    I am member of two choirs and love history and literature.

name: Spacious 2BR 2 bath, walk to Harvard & MIT
description: Welcome! This home is spacious and airy, with high ceilings and open floor plan.  Charming, historic house with all modern amenities: central A/C, stainless steel appliances, Wi-fi, and washer/dryer in unit. Complimentary coffee & tea. Quiet, residential street, yet close to everything: 10 min walk to Harvard,  20-30 min walk to MIT, bus or T (subway) to Boston (25 min). WholeFoods, restaurants, and shops around the corner, with lots more within 5-15 mins walk. Parking by arrangement.
neighborhood_overview: We're on a  tree-lined, quiet, residential street with brick sidewalks and charming 100-year old wood houses, but walking distance to everything. Around the corner are several restaurants and cafés: Dali's (tapas), Kebob factory (Indian), Bergamot (American / fusion), The Thirsty Scholar Pub, Darwin's (sandwiches and baked goods - yum!) and the Biscuit (bakery and café). If you want to eat in,  get stuff around the corner at Wholefoods, The Wine and Cheese Cask, and Savenor's the butcher. A short walk away are lots more shops, restaurants and night life in Inman Square (5min), Harvard Square (10-15 min) and Union Square (5-10min). Harvard Art Museums 10 min, public library and pool 3-5 min walk.
host_about:
Hi, I'm Kjersti, (yup, unusual name unless you're Norwegian - so I also answer to Kirsti or just K:).  I love to travel to places a bit off the beaten path. Closer to home I enjoy my kids, skiing, hiking, biking, Kung Fu, cooking, and spending time with  family and friends.  Looking forward to hearing from you! 
Best, 
Kjersti

name: A floor all to yourself in our historic home
description: Your own floor in our historic Cambridge row house. Originally built in 1846, the third level is recently renovated with a bedroom, bathroom, study and lots of natural light. Just steps from Kendall Square, Red Line, and Green Line. Perfect for a couple visiting for the weekend or a solo work traveler.
neighborhood_overview: This is a hidden gem. Located right next to the city courthouse, our cozy neighborhood is full of tiny treasures and bits of history. Walk around to see beautiful old brownstones, lush courtyards, and the site of the very first house built in Cambridge (the king gave the land to the man who surveyed Charlestown for the crown). You'll also find lots of great restaurants, cafés, bars, and shopping nearby.
host_about: I'm a designer living and working in Boston for the past 10 years, first for The Boston Globe and then Upstatement, a digital design firm. My wife and I love to travel and have both been an active Couchsurfers and AirBNB users (as both host and guest) for years.

name: Harvard Square -  free permitted on street parking
description:
WE NOW HAVE VERY FAST INTERNET SERVICE!
Located in Harvard Square, minutes away from HARVARD ,HARVARD LAW, and HARVARD BUSINESS SCHOOL The two bedroom home has two large living rooms with books and original art. An easy walk to reach two excellent cafe's or visit the Harvard Art Museum to see a Van Gogh or Cezanne or have a fabulous meal. *Also, this apartment is not owned by an investment firm or controlled by a property management company.
neighborhood_overview: Mount Auburn Street is a tree lined street with an eclectic array of local gardens lining the sidewalk.  The neighborhood is part of the Half Crown Marsh Conservation District with mostly Victorian architecture    The house is four doors away from Longfellow Park - designed by Charles Elliot in 1887.  Across the street is Riverbend Park where you can sit on a bench and watch the Charles River where rowing teams from the various universities often practice.  We have two cafes in the neighborhood. Darwins and Flour both very good and both close. Memorial Drive which runs alongside the Charles River ( a short block from our house) is closed for biking, roller skating etc. from 11am to 7pm on Sundays from the last Sunday in April until the 2nd Sunday in November.  Because of major universities located in Cambridge, the city is very international and you will hear many different languages spoken

neighborhood_overview: Fantastic Cambridge neighborhood! Near all public transportation, very short walk to Davis, Porter, Alewife and about a 20-25 minute walk to Harvard University or Tufts. Lesley is even closer. Parks, bike-path, Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, shops, music bars, restaurants are all within walking distance. The court is quiet and friendly.
host_about: Friendly, politically progressive, resourceful... I love hosting people from all over the world, and know the area well for a native NY'er. You will find the environment 'on the court' restful, peaceful and as one  guest from put it, "I  figured you were a healer of some sort-- because your home feels healing." Our place is relaxing and down to earth, with  an artistic and colorful ambiance, and lots of sunlight.

neighborhood_overview:
Riverside is a residential neighborhood located along the Charles River, which includes some of the oldest settled parts of Cambridge. Harvard Square and Central Square, both major commercial and transit centers, lie at either end of the neighborhood. Massachusetts Avenue, which connects the two squares, serves as the neighborhood’s retail. Smaller commercial areas exist along Putnam Avenue, Western Avenue and River Street.
Whole Foods (with wine and beer) is a 5-minute walk; the Charles River (with walking and biking paths) is a 3-minute walk.
This is a diverse and convenient neighborhood.

name: BnB! Sunny private bedroom/bath near Harvard
description: A private bedroom and private bath in a BoHo style condo  located in Huron Village, a quiet, safe neighborhood in Cambridge.  A continental breakfast is included. Harvard University, Harvard Square and access to public transport (the T)  are only a  15 minute walk along beautiful historic Brattle Street. A diversity of nearby restaurants, cafes, museums, pubs, shops and music and art experiences abound.  Boston is an easy T ride away.
neighborhood_overview: If you are going to visit Cambridge or Boston, this is a great place to stay. Huron Village is a quiet neighborhood full of families, walkers, runners and bicyclists. Its safe to walk here both day and night.  You can stop for a great dinner in Harvard Square and then enjoy a leisurely walk back to Huron Village along historic Brattle street.
host_about: I am a retired science teacher and school administrator.  When I travel, I love to go on  walking holidays. Walking allows me to pay more attention to the landscape and the surrounding architecture, which I love the most.   My favorite walking holiday so far has been through Cornwall, England.  No matter where I go, I always try to seek out some good jazz - especially Latin jazz! The small local music venues are often the best.   I have always been  curious about people, who they are, where they are from and what are their life stories. I look forward to lots of interesting conversations as both a host and a guest.
property_type: Private room in bed and breakfast

name: Urban oasis in Huron Village
description: The best of all possible worlds! Bright and airy  cathedral-ceilinged two-bedroom unit  in leafy and lovely Huron Village, across the street from Fresh Pond Reservoir trails, Blue Bikes docking station, and great nine-hole golf course. Walk, bike, drive, bus, or T to Harvard Square.  Great bakeries  and food from cheap eats to high end  in easy walking distance.  Additional guests can be accommodated for a  $50/night charge. Mass. STR certificate C0107520491.
neighborhood_overview: Huron Village is the best of all possible worlds: leafy, lovely, and quiet, it has all the urban amenities.  Fresh Pond Reservoir's  2 1/2 mile walking/running trail is right across the street, with a Blue Bikes docking station.  Within a half mile radius are three bakeries, a Whole Foods and a Trader Joe's and a dozen specialty food stores, not to mention foods from around the world for eat-in or take-out.  Don't miss E.H. Chocolatier.  From spring to Autumn, Formaggio hosts a Saturday afternoon outdoor barbecue, with fried chicken, ribs, and all the fixings.

description:

name: Room in Gorgeous Home betw M.I.T. & Harvard
description:
Private bedroom on first floor with shared bathroom on second floor in a beautifully renovated upscale 3 story two-family home in Central Square Cambridge.

CITY OF CAMBRIDGE | Certificate of Registration | Registration No: STR-11739
neighborhood_overview:
We are a recently retired couple from MIT. We live with our cat, Isis, in a vibrant urban neighborhood steps away from the T, cafes, shops, live theater and music, and Zagat-rated restaurants. Walk 10 minutes to MIT or 20 minutes to Harvard or take the T and be in either Harvard Square or Boston in 2 minutes.

Don't know Central Square? Check out this Boston.com video on the Square: https://youtu.be/tKY42t03GMs
host_about: My name is Carolyn and my husband, Bill, and I can greet you when you arrive. We also provide a contactless check-in / stay option. Starting in 2010, we spent 3 years working with an architect, lighting designer, contractor and landscape designer to re-envision our home and to create an apartment on our first floor. Our home, our apartment and the garden have turned out to be delightful retreats in the middle of a bustling city environment.

A plethora of bars, restaurants and public transit are very close to our residence. neighborhood_overview: North Cambridge is a lovely neighborhood. Elements of the suburbs and the city combined. We are one block from the main thoroughfare but live on a quiet street. name: Pretty private garden-level condo+parking near MIT
description:
Walking distance of MIT/Central/Tech Square and a number of nice cafes and bars in the heart of Cambridge.
+ Recently finished modern apartment;
+ Self-checkin with a smartlock;
+ Private apartment exclusively yours;
+ Private off-street entrance;
+ On-street parking permit included;
+ Work- and laptop-friendly spaces;
+ Sparkling clean with new appliances and fixtures.
neighborhood_overview:
Walk friendly: Walking distance (12-20 mins) to MIT, Kendall square, and east and mid Cambridge. A longer walk (~1.4 mi) or short Uber/Lyft/city bus ride to Harvard.

Runner friendly: Warm up with a walk/run ~1 mile to get to the Charles river, and then run a loop taking one bridge across the river to Boston and another back to create a 3 mile or 4 mile loop (depending on the bridge), and then cool down another ~1 mile to get back home. Except the bridges, Cambridge/Boston is really flat, perfect for easy jogs.

Groceries: Multiple Whole Foods locations within ~0.6 to ~0.8 miles; Star Market ~0.6 miles away; H Mart ~0.9 miles away.
host_about: Scientist, traveler, coffee lover, fitness freak, host, and an optimist with perhaps an irrational faith in humanity.

name: Stunning urban hideaway nearby Harvard Square
description: Charming apartment in a 19th century Victorian house conserves its period architectural details in recently renovated comfort. Light streams into this en-suite guest residence through gracious windows. Beautiful cabinetry and bookcases offer some evening reading. Enjoy the marble bathroom and hardware floors and well-appointed kitchenette. A stone's throw from Porter Square, where bars, cafes, boutiques, and transportation options abound. Minutes to Harvard,  MIT and Boston.
neighborhood_overview:
Historic, posh Avon Hill neighborhood is great for walking. This part of Cambridge in general has an abundance of old Victorian homes over several square miles. The Cooper-Frost-Austin house (1681), oldest in Cambridge, is just down the street. Raymond Park and playground is nearby as well. The Harvard campus is a short distance away, and in addition to the famous yard proposes the Natural History Museum and its renowned Art Museum. Historic Cambridge Common, where General Washington's troops assembled, is nearby as well. The Porter Square subway stop is a 3-minute walk, and one stop away from Davis square or Harvard Square.

For shopping an errands, we recommend:

Porter Square Post Office
Porter Square Book store
Caffe Nero
Cafe Bourbon
The Abbey (bistro)
Bagelsaurus bakery
The Toad (cozy live music bar)
Christopher's (bistro and sports bar)
Colette Wine Bar and Restaurant
Yume Wo Katare ramen bar
Lunder Arts Cen
host_about: Marie and Andrew have been living in Cambridge for nearly twenty years. Marie grew up in the romantic city of Paris, and is now a filmmaker, script writer, and university instructor. She also loves to cook and read. Andrew hails from the south, moved to Paris to study architecture, and now runs a design and visualization practice in Cambridge. Andrew and Marie love to travel and strike up unexpected friendships.

name: Private apartment with newly renovated kitchen
description: This spacious garden level 1 bedroom 1 bath guest suite is all yours to enjoy and call home for your visit. Private entrance through a tranquil garden area. The suite is nestled behind an old mansion and surrounded by greens. It is 5 minute walk to Wholefoods and 7 minute walk to Central T. It is right at the heart of Harvard and MIT, both within short distance. Charles River is only short run away.
neighborhood_overview: Central Square is truly the center of everything that's happening in Cambridge. Located right in between Harvard Square and Kendall Square (MIT), it's walking distance to both institutions and all the research centers in the area. I used to bike from Harvard to MIT when I was a student, a very pleasant 15 minute ride. Harvard Street is just two streets north of Massachusetts Avenue, which is the main street that connects these school and also directly leads to downtown. A simple Google search shows that there're more than twenty 4-Star+ coffee shops and countless 4-Star+ restaurants, you can walk to restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores, universities, just about everywhere.
host_about:
A world traveler trapped inside a body of an entrepreneur who wants to make the world a better place to live. This career path gave me the freedom to control my time and hence I was able to travel internationally at least a few times a year, I've been to over 15 countries across four continents, the pace's just too slow. I love staying at Airbnb to get local tips, make new friends, and as a way for me to enrich my global experience without physically traveling there, I want to become a host as well. Boston is a tourist destination for many reasons, and in Cambridge, I meet many intelligent, fun, and creative people all around the world. I hope to be a host and local guide for those who visiting Cambridge and Boston. 

My No.1 recommendation of a Must-watch movie: "Good Will Hunting". If you are coming to Boston/Cambridge, please do watch that movie, it will add some color to your Boston experience.

name: MIT/Kendall Lux 3BR Apartment
description:
This spacious 3-bed apt sleeps up to 8. All three bedrooms have a queen-size bed and feature comfortable mattresses, soft linens, and plenty of closet space. It includes a fully equipped kitchen with modern appliances, and the dining area has a large table that seats up to six people.

The apartment is situated in the heart of Cambridge, close to many of the city's top attractions, universities, and restaurants. Public transportation is easily accessible, with several bus and train stops nearby.
neighborhood_overview:
Cambridge is a city known for its world-renowned universities, cultural diversity, and eclectic dining and shopping options. Whether you're a student, a business traveler, or a tourist looking for a unique and authentic experience, Cambridge has something for everyone.

Just steps from the apartment, you'll find a variety of restaurants, cafes, and bars offering delicious cuisine from around the world. From traditional New England seafood to international delicacies, there's no shortage of dining options to explore.

Cambridge is also home to many of the world's top universities, including Harvard University and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT). Take a stroll through the picturesque Harvard Yard or visit the MIT Museum to learn about the city's rich academic history.

For those looking for outdoor activities, Cambridge has several parks and nature reserves to explore. The Charles River Esplanade offers scenic views of the city skyline and is

name: 800sq ft, 2BR Apartment w/ AC, Laundry, Parking
description:
800 square foot (75 square meter) solar powered, garden level, 2-bedroom apartment in Cambridge with private entrance, central air/heat, walk-in shower, full-size washer and dryer, kitchen, and two smart TVs with apps.

We offer free off-street parking for 1 car and are in walking distance to Davis Square (red-line subway station, restaurants, bars, shops, bowling, and theater).

The owners live upstairs and are happy to answer any questions during your stay.
neighborhood_overview:
The location is great for easy access to Harvard and Tufts universities and only 5 subway stops to downtown Boston (a 13 minute ride). Massachusetts Avenue is a block away with numerous restaurants and markets.

Davis Square is a 10 minute walk away and packed with restaurants, shops, cafes, bars, clubs, a theater, bowling alley, and supermarket.

The surrounding streets are primarily residential so it's typically very quiet at night for a city. However, we're still just one block away from tons of amenities.
host_about:
We are a gay couple in our 50's splitting our time between Cambridge, Massachusetts, (Davis Square area) and our summer houses in Provincetown, MA, and near Ogunquit, ME. We rent out all three properties if you're interested in any of our listings

Our interests include travel, architecture, wine, board games and cards games, and dinners out with friends.

We lived in Tokyo, Japan, for two years and that's where we got our start using AirBnB - as hosts and guests. We've also lived in various parts of the United States; including Boston, Cape Cod, and Salem (MA), Roanoke (VA), plus San Francisco and Irvine (CA).

name: Deluxe Queen at Ginkgo House
description: This sun-filled large bedroom is situated on the second floor our large Victorian-style house. It has four large windows with ample natural light and a view of our lovely ginkgo trees in the front. The room has one queen bed, and two twin beds for a perfect family stay up to four people, two adults and two children. This centrally situated house is only 7 minute walk from the red line subway station, 10 minute walk to Harvard, and a WholeFoods within 5 minute walk.
neighborhood_overview: Central Square is truly the center of everything that's happening in Cambridge. Located right in between Harvard Square and Kendall Square (MIT), it's walking distance to both institutions and all the research centers in the area. I used to bike from Harvard to MIT when I was a student, a very pleasant 15 minute ride. Harvard Street is just two streets north of Massachusetts Avenue, which is the main street that connects these school and also directly leads to downtown. A simple search shows that there're more than twenty 4-Star+ coffee shops and countless 4-Star+ restaurants, you can walk to restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores, universities, just about everywhere.
host_about:
A world traveler trapped inside a body of an entrepreneur who wants to make the world a better place to live. This career path gave me the freedom to control my time and hence I was able to travel internationally at least a few times a year, I've been to over 15 countries across four continents, the pace's just too slow. I love staying at Airbnb to get local tips, make new friends, and as a way for me to enrich my global experience without physically traveling there, I want to become a host as well. Boston is a tourist destination for many reasons, and in Cambridge, I meet many intelligent, fun, and creative people all around the world. I hope to be a host and local guide for those who visiting Cambridge and Boston. 

My No.1 recommendation of a Must-watch movie: "Good Will Hunting". If you are coming to Boston/Cambridge, please do watch that movie, it will add some color to your Boston experience.

name: Superior Queen 5 min from T
description: This sun-filled private bath guest room is situated on the second floor our large Victorian-style house. It has two large windows with ample natural light and a view of our lovely garden on the side. The room has one full bed, and a full-size sofa bed to fit up to three people. This centrally situated house is only 7 minute walk from the red line subway station, 10 minute walk to Harvard, and a WholeFoods within 5 minute walk.
neighborhood_overview: Central Square is truly the center of everything that's happening in Cambridge. Located right in between Harvard Square and Kendall Square (MIT), it's walking distance to both institutions and all the research centers in the area. I used to bike from Harvard to MIT when I was a student, a very pleasant 15 minute ride. Harvard Street is just two streets north of Massachusetts Avenue, which is the main street that connects these school and also directly leads to downtown. A simple search shows that there're more than twenty 4-Star+ coffee shops and countless 4-Star+ restaurants, you can walk to restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores, universities, just about everywhere.
host_about:
A world traveler trapped inside a body of an entrepreneur who wants to make the world a better place to live. This career path gave me the freedom to control my time and hence I was able to travel internationally at least a few times a year, I've been to over 15 countries across four continents, the pace's just too slow. I love staying at Airbnb to get local tips, make new friends, and as a way for me to enrich my global experience without physically traveling there, I want to become a host as well. Boston is a tourist destination for many reasons, and in Cambridge, I meet many intelligent, fun, and creative people all around the world. I hope to be a host and local guide for those who visiting Cambridge and Boston. 

My No.1 recommendation of a Must-watch movie: "Good Will Hunting". If you are coming to Boston/Cambridge, please do watch that movie, it will add some color to your Boston experience.

name: Wonderful Cambridge Apt. for Short and Long Stays!
description: Spacious and relaxed, this private, 2-bedroom/5-room apartment is located on the first floor of a classic "triple decker" near Porter and Davis Squares.  The apartment has a full kitchen, living and dining room, and access to a shared laundry room. Surrounded by a native plant garden and mature trees, this is a wonderful base for exploring Cambridge's universities, or for longer, sabbatical stays. Harvard Square is one T stop away, or 10 minute by bike / 25 minutes by foot.
neighborhood_overview: This is a culturally diverse, residential neighborhood in Cambridge — located between Porter Square and Huron Village.  The apartment is a 10 minute walk to the Porter Square T station, and 15 or 25 minutes to Davis or Harvard Squares respectively. There is Blue Bike station a block away at Raymond Park, and quick access to multiple parks and green spaces in West/North Cambridge.
host_about:
I live in Cambridge, MA, with my husband, two cats and a thriving native plant garden. 
I love learning people’s stories, and exloring new places, whether distant or local. 
Our properties  are dear to our family. Two, which I share with my sister,  belonged to our vibrant mother, who was a skilled horsewoman and enlightenment seeker. ✨

name: Huron Village House Shared Lower
description: You must love dogs! Bruno, my big, lovable mixed Rottweiler/Pitbull, and his little buddy Leo, an adorable Pomeranian, are part of the package. Guests must be comfortable living with and occasionally helping care for them. Ann, my roommate, is around more than me and maybe your point of contact. My brother and his wife have their dogs, Bodie and Teddy, live upstairs in a separate unit. Our Huron Village home offers cozy living spaces and sits in a quaint commercial neighborhood we adore.
neighborhood_overview:
There are a few restaurants literally across the street, a bank, high end grocery store Formaggio, and other cute shops.
About one-half mile west of Harvard Square and Fresh Pond is the Observatory Hill neighborhood. Its neighborhood retail and business center is found around the intersection of Concord and Huron Avenues. Further out Huron Avenue towards Fresh Pond is the set of businesses known as Huron Village. Both of these centers offer a variety of neighborhood restaurants, grocery stores, some small offices, and unique retail and specialty shops that serve the surrounding community.
host_about:
I am Democratic political consultant who travels a lot for business and pleasure both domestically and internationally. My homes are showcases for the various art and handicrafts I have picked up along the way.

I have homes in Kigali, Rwanda, Washington, DC and in Cambridge, MA that  I list on AIRBNB and try to use AIRBNB when I travel as well. 

My brother Adam manages the Cambridge house most of the time and will be your primary contact should you choose to stay there. My friend Whinock helps me manage guest communications in Kigali  and we have a full staff to support guests there.

name: Summer 2026 Cambridge home Tufts, Harvard
description: Our 3 bedroom apartment is on the 2nd and 3d  floors of our 2-family home on quiet, pretty Hollis Street, steps from Davis Square (Somerville) and Porter Square (Cambridge), and Harvard Square (Cambridge). which is 1.5 miles away. No car needed - you can walk anywhere or take public transportation.  It's a 5-8 minute walk to the Davis Square subway station where you can take the Red Line to downtown Boston - a 15 minute ride.
neighborhood_overview:
This is a safe neighborhood with a lot of open space. Besides our yard, which is considered large by city standards, there is a school with public playing fields, two playgrounds, and public tennis courts at the end of the street on Rindge Avenue. Right around the corner, on Sherman Street, there is a giant public park - Danehy Park - with playgrounds and playing fields, trails for walking and jogging, and in the winter, a giant hill for sledding.

The location gets even more perfect....You can get easily anywhere and everywhere from Hollis Street without a car. Walk, bike, or take public transportation. You will be close to the major universities, museums, medical centers, and other attractions of the Boston- Cambridge area. Hip Davis Square (Somerville) is just short five -minute walk, with its historic movie theater and great restaurants. There are many other restaurants right around the corner on Massachusetts Avenue, like Urban Kitchen (American), Café Barada (Middle-Eas
host_about:
I'm a college professor, with a husband and 3 grown kids and Cambridge is our home. We have a two family house in North Cambridge that was built in 1926. My husband, Gerry, and I live in the upstairs apartment and our first floor apartment is available for short and long-term guests. 

We also have a 3 bedroom cottage a few steps from Nantucket Sound in Harwich Port Cape Cod.  Sometimes we rent our cottage to guests in the summer months.

neighborhood_overview:
One of the most iconic neighborhoods located at the affluent Back Bay destination is full of shopping and dining places you must visit, along Newbury Street, all locals frequent designer boutiques, fashion chains, art galleries, and patio cafes set in elegant brick townhouses. You can walk a few streets over to Marlborough and Beacon to find peaceful, tree-lined streets where the crowds feel miles away.

Staying in Back Bay means quick access to almost any part of the city, whether it’s crossing the bridge to Cambridge or heading to dinner in the South End. The Green and Orange lines are just steps away, but the ability to walk almost anywhere in the city is the real draw for most residents. description: We welcome you to enjoy the sights and sounds of the city with us! Your Family will be close to everything when you stay at this centrally-located apartment. neighborhood_overview:
This is a residential neighborhood, with a playground and nearby dog park. A public swimming pool is a 5 minute walk, or take in a local little league game or the high school soccer and football teams on the nearby ball fields. Fly a kite or run track at nearby Danehy Field. Take in a round of golf at the public course. Access to a 13 mile bike path is 2 minutes away.

You are in walking distance to multiple restaurants and quick access to downtown Boston, Harvard Square and Kendall Square (M.I.T.)

neighborhood_overview:
Overview

Discover the heart of innovation at this beautiful apartment, nestled in the vibrant Kendall Square. This address places you in the dynamic center of Cambridge, within a thriving innovation district known for its fusion of creativity and resourcefulness. Immerse yourself in a community where everything is conveniently within reach – from grocery stores and a gym to a business center and an array of restaurants, all housed in the same building. Venture beyond, and you'll find that Kendall/MIT, Harvard Square, Downtown Boston, Back Bay, Beacon Hill, Seaport District, Logan International Airport, and major medical centers are all a mere 10-15 minutes away by foot or quick transit.

MIT Museum - 5 minutes
Harvard University - 5 minutes
Boston Common - 13 minutes

Museum of Science - 14 minutes

neighborhood_overview:
One of the most iconic neighborhoods located at the affluent Back Bay destination is full of shopping and dining places you must visit, along Newbury Street, all locals frequent designer boutiques, fashion chains, art galleries, and patio cafes set in elegant brick townhouses. You can walk a few streets over to Marlborough and Beacon to find peaceful, tree-lined streets where the crowds feel miles away.

Staying in Back Bay means quick access to almost any part of the city, whether it’s crossing the bridge to Cambridge or heading to dinner in the South End. The Green and Orange lines are just steps away, but the ability to walk almost anywhere in the city is the real draw for most residents. Access to cultural institutions like the Boston Public Library and Symphony Hall, as well as iconic green spaces like the Boston Public Garden and Commonwealth Mall is an obvious draw that explains why the area has maintained its desirability all the way from the Victorian era to the pres

neighborhood_overview:
Nestled in the heart of Boston, our apartment at our location in Boston Theater District places you in the vibrant Chinatown neighborhood. Immerse yourself in a rich cultural experience with authentic cuisine, bustling shops, and unique cultural attractions just steps away. Explore the area's diverse dining scene, from traditional dim sum restaurants to modern Asian fusion eateries. You'll find a variety of shops offering unique gifts, groceries, and traditional goods. With convenient access to public transportation, you can easily explore other parts of Boston, including the historic Freedom Trail and the trendy shops and restaurants of Downtown Crossing, both within a short distance. Experience the best of Boston's culture and culinary scene right outside your door!
